text.more:
This graph represents Fadigati's network before rumors about his sexuality start spreding (at the end of chapter 2), when he's still fully accepted as member of the bourgeoisie: the corpora is the first part of the text (chapters 1 and 2) and the various entities/nodes are firstly divided in types: there are Characters (identifiable with warmer colours) and Places (identifiable with colder colours). Then, each type is divided in classes: for what concerns the Places we have Ferrara, Bologna and the Adriatic Region; for what concerns the characters, we have different social classes and roles.
It is therefore possible to infer new connections and relations between the entities of the book and, by comparing it to Fadigati's second network, to understand how it changes.
text.intro:
Browse through the various relationships held by dott. Athos Fadigati before his outing (at the end of chapter 2).
Click on a node to see its connections or select different classes representing the book's communities: for places (Ferrara, Bologna or Adriatic locations) and people (historical and cultural characters, the group of students, the narrator's family, characters belonging to and representing the bourgeoisie and "others").
text.title: Fadigati's network - First Graph
